Trial_Design.evidence: From June 2019 to February 2024, a total of 265 patients with aortoiliac aneurysm from four tertiary hospitals in China were included.

Participants.evidence: 265 patients with aortoiliac aneurysm from four tertiary hospitals in China were included.

Intervention.evidence: preserving bilateral internal iliac arteries (IIAs) in patients with aortoiliac aneurysms using iliac branch stent grafts (IBSG).

Objective.evidence: The aim of study is to investigate the safety and efficacy of preserving bilateral internal iliac arteries (IIAs) in patients with aortoiliac aneurysms using iliac branch stent grafts (IBSG).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was major adverse events, and the secondary endpoint was pelvic ischemia.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From June 2019 to February 2024, a total of 265 patients with aortoiliac aneurysm from four tertiary hospitals in China were included.

Number_Analysed.evidence: After matching, there were 76 patients in the Group BB (38 patients) and the Group BU (38 patients)

Result_Outcome.evidence: 3 patients (7.9%) in the Group BB and 2 patients (5.3%) in the Group BU experienced IBSG occlusion.
